text:
The Fish Size Project is a research group led by Dr.Â Asta Audzijonyte at the University of Tasmania, Australia. Here, we are investigating everything relating to fish body size. One main research focus is understanding how species body size distributions are being impacted by human harvesting practices and climate change.
Interested? Tell me more

title: About
text:
This is where we have slightly more detailed information about the group.
To check out our current and past members, click here.

title: Amy Coghlan
text:
Freddie Heather is an ecological modeller with research interests in understanding human impacts on marine ecosystems. He is a post-doc in the Fish Size Project at the Institute for Marine and Antarctic Studies at the University of Tasmania.
Education
Ph.D., University of Tasmania - 2021 (Quantitative Marine Science)
MBiolSci, University of Sheffield - 2014 (Biology)
Experience
Postdoc, University of Tasmania - current (Marine ecology)
Postdoc, University of Tasmania - 2022 (Reef ecology)

title: Packages and apps
text:
Species-based size spectra
This R package, developed by Freddie Heather, is freely available to download from github.
